net.hudup.core.data

Interface ExternalQuery

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Alg, AlgRemoteTask, AutoCloseable, Exportable, ExternalQueryRemoteTask, java.io.Serializable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DefaultExternalQuery, ExternalQueryAbstract, ExternalQueryRemoteWrapper

    public interface ExternalQuery
extends ExternalQueryRemoteTask, Alg, AutoCloseable
    Alg is the most abstract interface for all algorithms. Alg is one of the most important interfaces. It declares the most basic methods in an algorithm. The most important thing is that every Alg owns a configuration specified by DataConfig class. Alg has five typical inherited interfaces as follows:
    • Recommendation algorithm Recommender.
    • Context template schema manager CTSManager.
    • Data set parser DatasetParser.
    • External query ExternalQuery.
    • Metric Metric.
    Therefore, this class is also an algorithm and it is discovered and registered in plug-in storage by plug-in manager. External query is mainly used to retrieve external information stored in outside database different from Hudup database. In current implementation, external query retrieve (queries) external information about user and item specified by ExternalUserInfo and ExternalItemInfo, respectively. Moreover, external query can fill in Hudup database by importing data from outside database.
    Version:
    10.0
    Author:
    Loc Nguyen
